approved_concepts.label: Total Population
approved_concepts.definition: Total count of people residing in the area

approved_concepts.label: Median Age
approved_concepts.definition: The median age of the total population

approved_concepts.label: Population Density
approved_concepts.definition: Number of people per square mile

approved_concepts.label: Gender Composition
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of population by sex/gender

approved_concepts.label: Age Distribution
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of population across age groups

approved_concepts.label: White Alone Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population reporting race as White alone

approved_concepts.label: Black or African American Alone Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population reporting race as Black or African American alone

approved_concepts.label: Asian Alone Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population reporting race as Asian alone

approved_concepts.label: Hispanic or Latino Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population of Hispanic or Latino origin (of any race)

approved_concepts.label: Child Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population under 18 years of age

approved_concepts.label: Working Age Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population aged 18-64 years

approved_concepts.label: Senior Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population aged 65 and older

approved_concepts.label: Total Households
approved_concepts.definition: Total number of households

approved_concepts.label: Average Household Size
approved_concepts.definition: Average number of people per household

approved_concepts.label: Foreign-Born Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population born outside the United States

approved_concepts.label: Native-Born Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population born in the United States

approved_concepts.label: Race and Ethnicity
approved_concepts.definition: Racial and ethnic composition of the population
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B02001 for race counts and B03002 for Hispanic/Latino origin by race. Both tables use the universe 'Total population' and provide direct counts for racial and ethnic composition.

approved_concepts.label: Family Households
approved_concepts.definition: Households with related individuals
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B11001_002 (Family households). Universe correctly specified as households, and count method is appropriate for this categorical demographic measure.

approved_concepts.label: Married Couple Households
approved_concepts.definition: Households with married couples
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B11001_003 (Married-couple family households). Note that this captures married-couple family households specifically, not all households containing married couples (e.g., excludes married couples living in non-family households with other unrelated individuals).

approved_concepts.label: Marital Status Distribution
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of population by marital status
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B12001 provides a direct count of the population 15 years and over by detailed marital status categories. The distribution can be obtained by using the counts in this table and, if needed, calculating proportions by dividing each category by the total population in the universe.

approved_concepts.label: Citizenship Status
approved_concepts.definition: Citizenship and naturalization status distribution
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B05001 table which provides complete citizenship status breakdown. Universe of 'Total population' is correct as citizenship status applies to all residents.

approved_concepts.label: Veteran Status
approved_concepts.definition: Military veteran status of civilian population
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Veteran status for the civilian population 18 years and over is directly available in ACS table B21001. Use B21001_002E (Civilian veterans) and B21001_003E (Civilian nonveterans) for counts. Universe is correctly specified.

approved_concepts.label: Language Spoken at Home
approved_concepts.definition: Languages spoken at home distribution
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B16001 provides a direct count of the population 5 years and over by language spoken at home. Use the relevant rows/variables for specific language groups as needed.

approved_concepts.label: English Language Proficiency
approved_concepts.definition: Ability to speak English proficiency levels
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B16004 table which provides detailed English-speaking ability by age groups. Universe correctly specified as 5+ years since language questions are only asked of this population.

approved_concepts.label: Young Adults (25-34)
approved_concepts.definition: Population aged 25-34 years
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Sum the male (B01001_007E) and female (B01001_031E) counts for the 25-29 and 30-34 age groups from B01001 to obtain the total population aged 25-34. Universe should be 'population' or 'total population', as in B01001.

approved_concepts.label: Middle Aged (45-54)
approved_concepts.definition: Population aged 45-54 years
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B01001 table. Sum cells B01001_013 through B01001_016 for males and B01001_037 through B01001_040 for females, or use total population cells if available in detailed age breakdowns.

approved_concepts.label: Children in Households
approved_concepts.definition: Presence and number of children in households
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B11005 ('Households by Presence of People Under 18 Years by Household Type') directly provides counts of households by presence and number of children. Use B11005_002E (households with one or more people under 18) and B11005_003E (households with no people under 18) for presence; subtotals by household type are also available.

approved_concepts.label: Multigenerational Households
approved_concepts.definition: Households with three or more generations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B11017_003 (3-generation households) + B11017_004 (4-or-more-generation households). Universe is all households, statistical method of count is appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Grandparents as Caregivers
approved_concepts.definition: Grandparents responsible for grandchildren
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B10051 provides direct counts of grandparents living with and responsible for grandchildren under 18, with breakdowns by age, sex, and other characteristics. The universe is correctly specified as 'Population 30 years and over.' Use B10051_001 for the total count.

approved_concepts.label: Unmarried Partner Households
approved_concepts.definition: Households with unmarried partners
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B11009_003 (Male householder and male partner) + B11009_004 (Male householder and female partner) + B11009_005 (Female householder and female partner) + B11009_006 (Female householder and male partner). Universe is correctly specified as households.

approved_concepts.label: Group Quarters Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population living in group quarters
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B26001_001 for total group quarters population. The universe for B26001 is the total population, matching the concept's universe.

approved_concepts.label: Institutionalized Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population in institutional group quarters
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B26001_002 (Institutionalized population). Universe correctly specified as total population in group quarters.

approved_concepts.label: Year of Entry for Foreign-Born
approved_concepts.definition: Year foreign-born population entered the US
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B05005 provides a direct count of the foreign-born population by year of entry. Use the relevant universe filter (foreign-born population) and select the appropriate year-of-entry columns.

approved_concepts.label: Sex Ratio
approved_concepts.definition: Ratio of males to females in population
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as B01001_002 (Male) / B01001_026 (Female). Standard demographic ratio typically expressed as males per 100 females or as decimal ratio.

approved_concepts.label: Median Age by Gender
approved_concepts.definition: Median age separately for males and females
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B01002 provides median age for the total population (B01002_001), males (B01002_002), and females (B01002_003). No calculation is needed beyond direct lookup.

approved_concepts.label: Households by Type and Size
approved_concepts.definition: Detailed breakdown of household types and sizes
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B11016 provides a direct cross-tabulation of household type (family/nonfamily, married-couple, etc.) by household size. Use the table's detailed line items for breakdowns.

approved_concepts.label: Median Household Income
approved_concepts.definition: The median income of households in the past 12 months (in inflation-adjusted dollars)

approved_concepts.label: Mean Household Income
approved_concepts.definition: The average (arithmetic mean) income of households in the past 12 months

approved_concepts.label: Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of people whose income in the past 12 months was below the poverty threshold

approved_concepts.label: Unemployment Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian labor force 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of the civilian labor force that is unemployed

approved_concepts.label: Median Family Income
approved_concepts.definition: The median income of families in the past 12 months (in inflation-adjusted dollars)

approved_concepts.label: Per Capita Income
approved_concepts.definition: Mean income computed for every man, woman, and child in a particular group

approved_concepts.label: Child Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population under 18 years for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of children under 18 years with income below poverty level

approved_concepts.label: Mean Commute Time
approved_concepts.universe: Workers 16 years and over who did not work at home
approved_concepts.definition: Mean travel time to work for workers

approved_concepts.label: Employment Population Ratio
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of the population 16 years and over that is employed
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as B23025_002 (employed) / B23025_001 (total population 16+) * 100. This is a standard labor force participation metric.

approved_concepts.label: Median Earnings
approved_concepts.universe: Population 16 years and over with earnings
approved_concepts.definition: The median earnings in the past 12 months for workers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Median earnings for the population 16 years and over with earnings is directly reported in ACS table B20002 (variable B20002_001). No calculation is required beyond direct lookup.

approved_concepts.label: Median Earnings for Males
approved_concepts.universe: Male population 16 years and over with earnings
approved_concepts.definition: The median earnings in the past 12 months for male workers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B20002_002 (Median earnings in the past 12 months for male population 16 years and over with earnings). This is a standard ACS detailed table with reliable estimates.

approved_concepts.label: Median Earnings for Females
approved_concepts.universe: Female population 16 years and over with earnings
approved_concepts.definition: The median earnings in the past 12 months for female workers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B20002_002 for median earnings of females 16 years and over with earnings. The universe and statistical method are appropriate and match the ACS table structure.

approved_concepts.label: Employment by Industry
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of employed workers across industry categories
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from detailed table C24050 which provides employment counts by industry classification. Universe specification is correct for civilian employed population 16+.

approved_concepts.label: Employment by Occupation
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of employed workers across occupation categories
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table C24010 (or B24010 for more detailed breakdowns) to obtain counts of the civilian employed population 16 years and over by occupation category. The universe and method (count) are appropriate. C24010 provides the required occupational distribution directly.

approved_concepts.label: Workers by Class of Worker
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of workers by class of worker (private, government, self-employed)
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from C24060 table which provides detailed breakdown of class of worker categories. Universe specification is correct and aligns with table coverage.

approved_concepts.label: Full-Time Workers
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers usually working 35 or more hours per week
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B23001 contains detailed employment status by age and sex, including full-time, year-round workers. Use the relevant cells for 'Civilian employed, at work, usually worked 35 or more hours per week' for the 16+ population.

approved_concepts.label: Poverty by Age Group
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Poverty rates by age groups
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B17001 to obtain both the numerator (population below poverty by age group) and denominator (total population by age group for whom poverty status is determined). Calculate the rate for each age group as (below poverty / total) * 100.

approved_concepts.label: Senior Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population 65 years and over for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of people 65 years and over with income below poverty level
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Senior poverty rate is a standard demographic indicator calculated from ACS table B17001. Sum poverty counts for males 65-74, males 75+, females 65-74, and females 75+, then divide by total 65+ population with determined poverty status.

approved_concepts.label: Family Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Families for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of families with income below poverty level
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the family poverty rate as the percentage of families (denominator: total families for whom poverty status is determined, B17010_001) with income below the poverty level (numerator: B17010_002). The calculation is (B17010_002 / B17010_001) * 100.

approved_concepts.label: Wages and Salaries
approved_concepts.universe: Households with wage and salary income
approved_concepts.definition: Wage and salary income from employment
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B19051_001 (median wage and salary income). Universe is automatically restricted to households with wage/salary income as specified in table definition.

approved_concepts.label: Real Median Household Income
approved_concepts.definition: Median household income adjusted for inflation to constant dollars
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B19013_001 for median household income. ACS publishes this value in inflation-adjusted (constant) dollars for the survey year. Universe is all households.

approved_concepts.label: Service Occupations
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in service occupations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from C24010 table. Service occupations are clearly defined in Census occupation classification system and readily available as counts.

approved_concepts.label: Sales and Office Occupations
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in sales and office occupations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24010 (Sex by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or B24010 for direct counts of 'Sales and Office Occupations' by sex. The occupation category is a standard ACS classification and is directly reported.

approved_concepts.label: Production, Transportation, and Material Moving Occupations
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in production, transportation, and material moving occupations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from C24010 table. This is a standard SOC major occupational group that Census tracks consistently. Universe specification is correct for civilian labor force statistics.

approved_concepts.label: Income by Household Size
approved_concepts.definition: Median household income by number of persons in household
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B19019 provides median household income estimates broken down by household size (1-person through 7+ persons). Each estimate includes margin of error for ACS data. Universe definition is correct as 'households'.

approved_concepts.label: Income by Age of Householder
approved_concepts.definition: Median household income by age of householder
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B19049 provides the median household income by age of householder directly, broken out by standard age categories. Use the relevant B19049_00X variables for each age group.

approved_concepts.label: Deep Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of people with income below 50% of poverty threshold
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Deep poverty rate is not a direct ACS estimate but can be calculated from B17002. Sum the population in income categories below 0.50 of the poverty threshold (B17002_002 and B17002_003), then divide by the total universe (B17002_001).

approved_concepts.label: Near Poverty Rate (150% of poverty)
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of people with income below 150% of poverty threshold
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as sum of income categories below 150% poverty (C17002_002 through C17002_005) divided by total population for whom poverty status is determined (C17002_001), then multiply by 100 for percentage.

approved_concepts.label: Low Income Rate (200% of poverty)
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of people with income below 200% of poverty threshold
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the rate as the sum of persons in C17002 columns representing income-to-poverty ratios below 2.00 (i.e., C17002_002 through C17002_004), divided by the total universe (C17002_001). B17002 is the base table with more detail, but C17002 is the collapsed version and is sufficient.

approved_concepts.label: Social Security Income
approved_concepts.definition: Social Security income from retirement, survivors, and disability benefits
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B19055_001 (median Social Security income). Universe is appropriately defined as households with Social Security income, making the median a meaningful measure of central tendency for this population.

approved_concepts.label: SNAP/Food Stamp Benefits
approved_concepts.definition: Households receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B22003 provides a direct count of households receiving SNAP benefits. Use B22003_002E for the estimate of households receiving SNAP benefits. The universe is all households.

approved_concepts.label: Self-Employment Income
approved_concepts.definition: Net income from self-employment including business and farm income
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B19052_001 (median self-employment income). Universe is automatically defined by households with positive self-employment income.

approved_concepts.label: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in agriculture, forestry, fishing and hunting industry
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24050 (Industry by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or B24050 for base counts. The industry category 'Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting' is a standard row in these tables. Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Manufacturing Industry
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in manufacturing industry
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24050 (Industry by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or B24050 for the 1-year ACS. The 'Manufacturing' industry is a standard row in these tables. Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Healthcare and Social Assistance Industry
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in healthcare and social assistance industry
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24050 (Industry by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or its base table B24050. The Healthcare and Social Assistance industry is a standard NAICS-based category in these tables. Select the relevant row for this industry; the universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Accommodation and Food Services Industry
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Workers employed in accommodation and food services industry
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24050 (Industry by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or B24050 for detailed counts. The 'Accommodation and Food Services' industry is a standard category in these tables, and the universe matches the concept.

approved_concepts.label: Earnings by Education Level
approved_concepts.universe: Population 25 years and over with earnings
approved_concepts.definition: Median earnings by detailed educational attainment levels
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B20004 table which provides median earnings by detailed educational attainment for population 25+ with earnings. Each education level has its own column with pre-calculated medians.

approved_concepts.label: Work From Home
approved_concepts.definition: Workers who primarily work from home
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B08301_021 (Worked from home). Universe matches table universe exactly.

approved_concepts.label: Weeks Worked Per Year
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of workers by number of weeks worked in the past 12 months
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B23022 which provides complete distribution of weeks worked. Universe correctly specified as 16+ population. Count method appropriate for categorical distribution.

approved_concepts.label: Income by Race and Ethnicity
approved_concepts.definition: Median household income by race and Hispanic or Latino origin
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Each table (B19013A-I) provides the median household income for a specific race or Hispanic origin group. Use the estimate in the first data cell (e.g., B19013A_001E) for each group. Universe is households.

approved_concepts.label: Poverty by Race and Ethnicity
approved_concepts.universe: Population for whom poverty status is determined
approved_concepts.definition: Poverty rates by race and Hispanic or Latino origin
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Each table provides poverty status by income-to-poverty ratio for specific racial/ethnic groups. Calculate poverty rate as (below poverty level / total for whom poverty status determined) * 100 for each group.

approved_concepts.label: Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Highest level of education completed by individuals

approved_concepts.label: High School Graduation Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of population with high school diploma or equivalent

approved_concepts.label: Bachelor's Degree Attainment Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of population with bachelor's degree or higher

approved_concepts.label: College Enrollment
approved_concepts.definition: Students enrolled in college or graduate school

approved_concepts.label: Less Than High School Education
approved_concepts.definition: Population without high school diploma or equivalent

approved_concepts.label: Associate Degree Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Population with associate degree

approved_concepts.label: Master's Degree Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Population with master's degree

approved_concepts.label: Income by Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.universe: Population 25 years and over with earnings
approved_concepts.definition: Median earnings by educational attainment level

approved_concepts.label: School Enrollment
approved_concepts.definition: Number of people enrolled in educational institutions
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B14001_001 for total population 3 years and over enrolled in school. Subcategories (e.g., by level) are also available in B14001.

approved_concepts.label: Preschool Enrollment
approved_concepts.definition: Children ages 3-4 enrolled in preschool programs
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B14003_003 (enrolled in preschool) for population 3-4 years old. Universe is correctly specified as this table covers exactly the target age range.

approved_concepts.label: Public School Enrollment
approved_concepts.definition: Students enrolled in public educational institutions
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B14002 provides counts of the population 3 years and over by school enrollment status and type of school (public/private). The sum of the relevant 'public school' cells yields the total public school enrollment for the specified universe.

approved_concepts.label: Private School Enrollment
approved_concepts.definition: Students enrolled in private educational institutions
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B14002 table. Private school enrollment is available in columns 004, 007, 010, 013, 016, 019 for different age groups. Sum these columns for total private school enrollment.

approved_concepts.label: Professional Degree Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Population with professional degree (JD, MD, etc.)
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B15003_024 (Professional degree) from the detailed educational attainment table. Universe of 25+ is standard for educational attainment statistics.

approved_concepts.label: Doctorate Degree Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Population with doctorate degree
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B15003 (Sex by Educational Attainment for the Population 25 Years and Over). The count of individuals with a doctorate degree is found in B15003_025 (Doctorate degree). Sum across sex if needed.

approved_concepts.label: Field of Bachelor's Degree
approved_concepts.universe: Population 25 years and over with bachelor's degree
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of bachelor's degrees by field of study
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B15012 table which provides detailed breakdown of bachelor's degrees by field of study. Universe restriction to 25+ with bachelor's degree is correctly specified and matches table universe.

approved_concepts.label: Educational Attainment by Age
approved_concepts.definition: Educational attainment cross-tabulated by age groups
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B15001 provides a complete cross-tabulation matrix of educational attainment by age groups for population 25+. Data can be extracted directly without calculation.

approved_concepts.label: Educational Attainment by Gender
approved_concepts.definition: Educational attainment cross-tabulated by sex
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B15002 provides a direct cross-tabulation of educational attainment by sex for the population 25 years and over. Use the detailed cells for male and female breakdowns by attainment level.

approved_concepts.label: Poverty by Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.universe: Population 25 years and over for whom poverty status determined
approved_concepts.definition: Poverty rate by educational attainment level
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B17003 provides counts of persons 25+ by educational attainment and poverty status. Calculate the poverty rate for each educational attainment level by dividing the number below poverty (B17003_0XX) by the total for that attainment (sum of B17003_0XX and B17003_0YY for each level). Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Employment by Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian labor force 25 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Employment rate by educational attainment level
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate employment rates by dividing employed population by total civilian labor force within each educational attainment category. Universe restriction to 25+ is appropriate as educational attainment is typically measured for this age group.

approved_concepts.label: Veteran Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Educational attainment among veterans...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B21003 (Veteran Status by Educational Attainment for the Civilian Population 25 Years and Over). The universe and statistical method (count) are appropriate. Extract relevant rows for veterans only.

approved_concepts.label: Educational Attainment with Disability
approved_concepts.universe: Population 25 years and over with disability
approved_concepts.definition: Educational attainment among population with disabilities...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B18120 (Educational Attainment by Disability Status for the Civilian Noninstitutionalized Population 25 Years and Over) to obtain counts of educational attainment among people with and without disabilities. The relevant universe is directly available in this table.

approved_concepts.label: Commuting by Educational Attainment
approved_concepts.definition: Mean travel time to work by educational attainment...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate mean travel time within educational attainment categories using B08303 series. Cross-tabulation already exists in Census data structure.

approved_concepts.label: Nation
approved_concepts.definition: Singleton United States root geography

approved_concepts.label: Census Region
approved_concepts.definition: 4 Census regions (Northeast, Midwest, South, West)

approved_concepts.label: Census Division
approved_concepts.definition: 9 divisions nested in regions

approved_concepts.label: State
approved_concepts.definition: 50 states + DC + PR

approved_concepts.label: County
approved_concepts.definition: County or county equivalent (parish, borough, etc.)

approved_concepts.label: County Subdivision
approved_concepts.definition: Minor civil divisions, townships, unorganized territories

approved_concepts.label: Place
approved_concepts.definition: Incorporated places and census designated places (CDPs)

approved_concepts.label: Census Tract
approved_concepts.definition: Small statistical subdivisions of counties (1,200-8,000 people)

approved_concepts.label: Block Group
approved_concepts.definition: Subdivisions of census tracts (600-3,000 people)

approved_concepts.label: Census Block
approved_concepts.definition: Atomic geography - smallest geographic entity

approved_concepts.label: Public Use Microdata Area
approved_concepts.definition: Areas with 100,000+ population for microdata samples

approved_concepts.label: ZIP Code Tabulation Area
approved_concepts.definition: Statistical approximation of postal ZIP codes

approved_concepts.label: Urban Area
approved_concepts.definition: Urbanized areas and urban clusters

approved_concepts.label: Core-based Statistical Area
approved_concepts.definition: Metropolitan and micropolitan statistical areas

approved_concepts.label: School District
approved_concepts.definition: Elementary, secondary, and unified school districts

approved_concepts.label: Congressional District
approved_concepts.definition: 118th Congress vintage congressional districts

approved_concepts.label: State Legislative District
approved_concepts.definition: Upper and lower chamber legislative districts

approved_concepts.label: AIANNH Area
approved_concepts.definition: American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian areas

approved_concepts.label: American Indian Reservation
approved_concepts.definition: Federal and state American Indian reservations

approved_concepts.label: Health Insurance Coverage
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of population with health insurance coverage

approved_concepts.label: Uninsured Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of population without health insurance

approved_concepts.label: Disability Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of population with a disability
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Disability rate is calculated as the percentage of the civilian noninstitutionalized population with a disability. Use B18101: 'SEX BY AGE BY DISABILITY STATUS'—sum the relevant disability counts (B18101_004, B18101_007, etc.) and divide by the total civilian noninstitutionalized population (B18101_001).

approved_concepts.label: Disability by Age
approved_concepts.definition: Disability status by age groups
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B18101 which provides disability status cross-tabulated by detailed age groups. Universe specification is correct for ACS disability questions.

approved_concepts.label: Hearing Difficulty
approved_concepts.definition: Population with hearing difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B18102 table. Use appropriate cells for hearing difficulty status by age groups as needed.

approved_concepts.label: Vision Difficulty
approved_concepts.definition: Population with vision difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B18102 provides a direct count of the civilian noninstitutionalized population with vision difficulty. Use B18102_002E for the estimate of people with vision difficulty. Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Cognitive Difficulty
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian noninstitutionalized population 5 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population with cognitive difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B18102_002 for count of population with cognitive difficulty. The ACS defines cognitive difficulty as having serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition.

approved_concepts.label: Ambulatory Difficulty
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian noninstitutionalized population 5 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population with ambulatory difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B18102 provides counts of the civilian noninstitutionalized population 5 years and over with ambulatory difficulty. Use the relevant line item (typically B18102_004 for total with ambulatory difficulty) for direct lookup.

approved_concepts.label: Self-Care Difficulty
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian noninstitutionalized population 5 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population with self-care difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B18102 table. Use appropriate cells for 'With a self-care difficulty' by age groups as needed.

approved_concepts.label: Independent Living Difficulty
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian noninstitutionalized population 18 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population with independent living difficulty
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B18102 (SEX BY INDEPENDENT LIVING DIFFICULTY FOR THE CIVILIAN NONINSTITUTIONALIZED POPULATION 18 YEARS AND OVER). The relevant estimate is the sum of male and female populations with independent living difficulty (B18102_004 + B18102_007). Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Veteran Status
approved_concepts.definition: Population who served in US Armed Forces
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B21001_002 (veteran population) with universe from B21001_001 (total civilian population 18+). Can also calculate veteran rate as B21001_002/B21001_001.

approved_concepts.label: Veterans by Service Period
approved_concepts.definition: Veterans by period of military service
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B21002 provides a direct count of civilian veterans 18 years and over by period of military service. Use the relevant B21002 variables for each service period category.

approved_concepts.label: Veteran Disability Status
approved_concepts.definition: Veterans with service-connected disability
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as rate using B21007_002 (veterans with service-connected disability) divided by B21007_001 (total civilian veterans 18+). Universe specification is correct and aligns with table coverage.

approved_concepts.label: SNAP Benefits
approved_concepts.definition: Households receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the rate as the share of households receiving SNAP benefits (B22003_002) divided by the total number of households (B22003_001) from table B22003. Universe is correctly specified as households.

approved_concepts.label: SSI Recipients
approved_concepts.definition: Recipients of Supplemental Security Income
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B19056_002 (With Supplemental Security Income). Universe should be 'Households' rather than 'Population' as SSI receipt is measured at household level in this table.

approved_concepts.label: Public Assistance Income
approved_concepts.definition: Households receiving public assistance income
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B19058_002 (Households with public assistance income) for the count of households receiving public assistance income. Universe is all households.

approved_concepts.label: Elderly Living Arrangements
approved_concepts.definition: Living arrangements for elderly population
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B09020 table which provides detailed living arrangement categories for population 65+. Universe and count method are appropriate for this demographic breakdown.

approved_concepts.label: Child Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population under 18 years for whom poverty status determined
approved_concepts.definition: Poverty rate among children under 18
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate by dividing the number of children under 18 below poverty (B17006_002) by the total population under 18 for whom poverty status is determined (B17006_001).

approved_concepts.label: Elderly Poverty Rate
approved_concepts.universe: Population 65 years and over for whom poverty status determined
approved_concepts.definition: Poverty rate among elderly population
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as (B17006_002 / B17006_001) * 100. Universe is population 65+ for whom poverty status is determined, which excludes institutionalized populations and those with insufficient income data.

approved_concepts.label: Medicaid Coverage
approved_concepts.definition: Population covered by Medicaid
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B27003 provides counts of the civilian noninstitutionalized population by health insurance coverage type, including Medicaid. The rate can be calculated as the number of people with Medicaid coverage (B27003, specific columns) divided by the total civilian noninstitutionalized population (B27003_001).

approved_concepts.label: Medicare Coverage
approved_concepts.definition: Population covered by Medicare
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate rate as (sum of Medicare coverage categories) / (total civilian noninstitutionalized population). Table B27003 provides detailed Medicare coverage by age groups.

approved_concepts.label: Private Health Insurance
approved_concepts.definition: Population with private health insurance
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the rate as the proportion of the civilian noninstitutionalized population with private health insurance coverage using B27003: Numerator is the sum of relevant cells indicating private coverage; denominator is the total civilian noninstitutionalized population.

approved_concepts.label: Tricare Coverage
approved_concepts.definition: Population covered by Tricare/military health care
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as (Tricare covered population / Total civilian noninstitutionalized population) * 100. Use B27003_005 for numerator and B27003_001 for denominator.

approved_concepts.label: Healthcare Workers
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population employed in healthcare occupations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Sum healthcare occupation categories from C24010. Healthcare occupations are typically found in the 'Healthcare practitioners and technical occupations' and 'Healthcare support occupations' major groups.

approved_concepts.label: Social Workers
approved_concepts.universe: Civilian employed population 16 years and over
approved_concepts.definition: Population employed as social workers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use C24010 (Sex by Occupation for the Civilian Employed Population 16 Years and Over) or B24010 for detailed occupation counts. Social workers are a distinct line item (SOC code 21-1020) in these tables. Universe and method are appropriate.

approved_concepts.label: Median Home Value
approved_concepts.definition: Median value of owner-occupied housing units

approved_concepts.label: Median Gross Rent
approved_concepts.universe: Renter-occupied housing units paying cash rent
approved_concepts.definition: Median gross rent paid by renter-occupied housing units

approved_concepts.label: Housing Tenure
approved_concepts.definition: Owner-occupied versus renter-occupied housing units

approved_concepts.label: Homeownership Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of occupied housing units that are owner-occupied

approved_concepts.label: Total Housing Units
approved_concepts.definition: Total number of housing units in area

approved_concepts.label: Occupied Housing Units
approved_concepts.definition: Number of housing units with residents

approved_concepts.label: Average Household Size
approved_concepts.definition: Average number of people per occupied housing unit

approved_concepts.label: Housing Vacancy Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of housing units that are vacant
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Housing Vacancy Rate is calculated as (Vacant housing units / Total housing units) * 100. Both numerator and denominator are available in ACS Table B25002: B25002_003E (Vacant) and B25002_001E (Total).

approved_concepts.label: Vacant Housing Units
approved_concepts.definition: Number of housing units without residents
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25002_003 (Vacant housing units). Universe correctly specified as housing units. Count method appropriate for enumeration data.

approved_concepts.label: Severe Housing Cost Burden
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage paying 50% or more of income for housing
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as percentage of occupied housing units paying 50%+ of income for housing costs. Use B25070 for owner-occupied and B25091 for renter-occupied units, or aggregate both for total severe burden rate.

approved_concepts.label: Rent Burden
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of renters paying 30% or more of income for rent
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as the proportion of renter-occupied housing units (universe) paying 30% or more of household income on gross rent (numerator: B25070_007E through B25070_010E; denominator: B25070_001E).

approved_concepts.label: Owner Cost Burden
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of owners paying 30% or more of income for housing
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as (B25091_008 + B25091_009 + B25091_010 + B25091_011) / B25091_001 * 100. This represents owners paying 30.0-34.9%, 35.0-39.9%, 40.0-49.9%, and 50.0%+ of income for housing costs.

approved_concepts.label: Year Structure Built
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of housing units by year built
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B25034 to obtain the distribution of housing units by year structure built. The universe is correctly specified as 'housing units.' Each row in B25034 corresponds to a year range, and the table provides counts for each category.

approved_concepts.label: Median Year Structure Built
approved_concepts.definition: Median year housing structures were built
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25035_001. This is a standard ACS housing characteristic with established methodology for calculating median from grouped year ranges.

approved_concepts.label: Units in Structure
approved_concepts.definition: Number of housing units in building structure
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B25024. The universe is 'housing units.' Each row in B25024 corresponds to a category of units in structure (e.g., 1-unit detached, 2 units, 5-9 units, etc.). The count is a direct lookup for each category or the total.

approved_concepts.label: Single Family Detached Homes
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units in single-family detached structures
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25024_002 (1-unit, detached). Universe and statistical method are correctly specified.

approved_concepts.label: Multifamily Housing
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units in structures with 2+ units
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B25024 to sum all units in structure categories with 2 or more units (i.e., B25024_003 through B25024_007). Exclude single-family detached and attached (B25024_002, B25024_003). The universe is housing units.

approved_concepts.label: Mobile Homes
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units that are mobile homes or trailers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25024_006 (Mobile home) and B25024_007 (Boat, RV, van, etc.) if including all mobile/temporary housing types, or just B25024_006 for mobile homes specifically

approved_concepts.label: Number of Bedrooms
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of housing units by number of bedrooms
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B25041 (Bedrooms) for direct counts of housing units by number of bedrooms. Universe is 'housing units.' Each column in B25041 corresponds to a specific bedroom count category (e.g., no bedroom, 1 bedroom, etc.).

approved_concepts.label: Number of Rooms
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of housing units by total number of rooms
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B25017 table which provides complete distribution of housing units by number of rooms (1 room through 9+ rooms). Universe correctly specified as housing units.

approved_concepts.label: Median Number of Rooms
approved_concepts.definition: Median number of rooms in housing units
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: The median number of rooms in housing units is directly reported in ACS table B25018 (variable B25018_001). No calculation is required beyond direct lookup.

approved_concepts.label: Heating Fuel
approved_concepts.definition: Primary fuel used for heating housing units
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B25040 table. Categories include utility gas, bottled/tank/LP gas, electricity, fuel oil/kerosene, coal/coke, wood, solar energy, other fuel, and no fuel used.

approved_concepts.label: Kitchen Facilities
approved_concepts.definition: Presence and completeness of kitchen facilities
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B25051 provides direct counts of housing units with and without complete kitchen facilities. Use B25051_001 for total housing units and B25051_002/B25051_003 for breakdown by presence/completeness of kitchen facilities.

approved_concepts.label: Plumbing Facilities
approved_concepts.definition: Presence and completeness of plumbing facilities
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25047 table which provides complete/incomplete plumbing facilities breakdown for housing units

approved_concepts.label: Vehicles Available
approved_concepts.definition: Number of vehicles available to household
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B08201 (HOUSEHOLD SIZE BY VEHICLES AVAILABLE) for direct counts of vehicles available to occupied housing units. The universe is correctly specified as 'occupied housing units.' Each row in B08201 corresponds to a count of households by number of vehicles available.

approved_concepts.label: Households Without Vehicle
approved_concepts.definition: Households with no vehicle available
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B08201_002 (No vehicle available). Universe correctly specified as occupied housing units.

approved_concepts.label: Overcrowded Housing
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units with more than 1 person per room
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B25014 provides counts of occupied housing units by persons-per-room. Overcrowded housing is defined as units with more than 1.00 person per room. The rate is calculated as the number of such units (sum of relevant B25014 cells) divided by the total number of occupied housing units (B25014_001).

approved_concepts.label: Mortgage Status
approved_concepts.definition: Owner-occupied units with and without mortgage
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B25081 which provides counts of owner-occupied units with and without mortgages. Universe restriction to owner-occupied units is correctly specified.

approved_concepts.label: Monthly Owner Costs
approved_concepts.definition: Median monthly owner costs including mortgage, taxes, insurance
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B25088_001 for the median monthly owner costs (dollars) for owner-occupied housing units. This variable directly reports the required statistic, including mortgage, taxes, and insurance.

approved_concepts.label: Property Taxes
approved_concepts.definition: Median annual property taxes paid
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B25103_001 (median real estate taxes paid). Universe restriction to owner-occupied units is inherent in the table design.

approved_concepts.label: Year Householder Moved In
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution by year current householder moved in
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B25026 table which provides year householder moved in categories. Universe specification is correct for occupied housing units.

approved_concepts.label: Housing Tenure by Age
approved_concepts.definition: Housing tenure by age of householder
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B25007 provides a direct cross-tabulation of housing tenure (owner/renter) by age of householder for occupied housing units. Use the detailed line items for specific age and tenure breakdowns.

approved_concepts.label: Housing Tenure by Income
approved_concepts.definition: Housing tenure by household income
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B25118 provides a direct cross-tabulation of housing tenure (owner/renter) by household income brackets. Data can be extracted directly without calculation.

approved_concepts.label: Group Quarters Population
approved_concepts.definition: People living in institutional and non-institutional group quarters
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B26001_001, which provides the total population in group quarters (both institutionalized and noninstitutionalized) as a direct count. No calculation or derivation is necessary.

approved_concepts.label: Rental Vacancy Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of rental units that are vacant
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as (vacant for rent units / total rental housing units) * 100. Use B25004_002 (vacant for rent) as numerator and sum of occupied rental units plus vacant for rent units as denominator.

approved_concepts.label: Computer Access
approved_concepts.definition: Households with computer access
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B28001 provides counts of occupied housing units by computer ownership status. The rate of households with computer access can be calculated as the share of occupied housing units with any type of computer (B28001_002E) divided by the total number of occupied housing units (B28001_001E).

approved_concepts.label: Housing Value Distribution
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of housing values by price range
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B25075 which provides complete value distribution across standard price ranges. Universe restriction to owner-occupied units is correctly specified.

approved_concepts.label: Rent Distribution
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution of gross rent by price range
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B25063 provides the count of renter-occupied housing units by gross rent intervals. Use the detailed rows (excluding totals and 'no cash rent') to construct the rent distribution.

approved_concepts.label: Housing Stability
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of households in same residence for 5+ years
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as (B25026_007 + B25026_008) / B25026_001 * 100. Categories 007 and 008 represent households in same residence 5-14 years and 15+ years respectively.

approved_concepts.label: Severely Overcrowded Housing
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units with more than 1.5 persons per room...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS Table B25014 (Tenure by Occupants per Room). Numerator: occupied housing units with >1.51 occupants per room (columns for '1.51 or more occupants per room' for both owner- and renter-occupied units). Denominator: total occupied housing units. Calculate rate as numerator/denominator.

approved_concepts.label: Seasonal Vacancy Rate
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of vacant units held for seasonal use...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Seasonal Vacancy Rate is calculated as the number of vacant housing units for seasonal/recreational/occasional use divided by the total number of vacant housing units. Both values are available in ACS Table B25004 (VACANCY STATUS). Use B25004_006 for the numerator and B25004_001 for the denominator.

approved_concepts.label: Cooperative Housing
approved_concepts.definition: Housing units in cooperative ownership...
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B25003 (Tenure) for universe of occupied housing units, and B25032 (Tenure by Units in Structure) or B25038 (Tenure by Selected Characteristics) for cooperative housing counts. Specifically, B25032 includes a row for 'Cooperative housing' under owner-occupied units.

approved_concepts.label: Foreign-Born Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population born outside the United States

approved_concepts.label: Naturalized Citizens
approved_concepts.definition: Foreign-born population who became US citizens
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: B05001 contains a direct count of the foreign-born population by citizenship status. The variable B05001_020E (Estimate!!Total!!Foreign born!!Naturalized U.S. citizen) provides the required count. Universe is correctly specified as the foreign-born population.

approved_concepts.label: Non-Citizens
approved_concepts.definition: Population who are not US citizens
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as sum of B05001_005 (naturalized citizens) + B05001_006 (not a citizen). Alternatively, subtract B05001_002 (native born) + B05001_005 (naturalized) from B05001_001 (total).

approved_concepts.label: Year of Entry
approved_concepts.definition: Distribution by year foreign-born entered US
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B05005 table which provides year of entry categories for foreign-born population. Can be presented as counts or percentages by year ranges.

approved_concepts.label: Region of Birth
approved_concepts.definition: Foreign-born population by world region of birth
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use ACS table B05006. The universe is the foreign-born population, and the table provides counts by world region of birth. No calculation is required beyond direct lookup of the relevant rows.

approved_concepts.label: Country of Birth
approved_concepts.definition: Foreign-born population by specific country of birth
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B05006 table which provides detailed country of birth breakdowns for foreign-born population. Universe correctly specified as foreign-born population.

approved_concepts.label: Limited English Proficiency
approved_concepts.definition: Population speaking English less than very well
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the rate as the number of people age 5+ who speak English 'less than very well' (sum of relevant rows in B16001) divided by the total population age 5+ (B16001_001).

approved_concepts.label: Spanish Speakers
approved_concepts.definition: Population speaking Spanish at home
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B16001_003 (Spanish speakers) with universe from B16001_001 (total population 5+ years)

approved_concepts.label: American Indian and Alaska Native Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population identifying as American Indian or Alaska Native
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from B02001_004 (American Indian and Alaska Native alone) or B02001_005 (American Indian and Alaska Native alone or in combination with one or more other races) depending on desired specificity

approved_concepts.label: Multiracial Population
approved_concepts.definition: Population identifying with two or more races
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: The count of the multiracial population is directly available in ACS table B02001 (Race), specifically in variable B02001_008 ('Two or more races'). Universe is 'Total population.'

approved_concepts.label: Multigenerational Households
approved_concepts.definition: Households with three or more generations
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B11017_003 (3-generation households) + B11017_004 (4+ generation households). Universe correctly specified as family households.

approved_concepts.label: Mean Commute Time
approved_concepts.definition: Mean travel time to work in minutes

approved_concepts.label: Commute Mode
approved_concepts.definition: Primary means of transportation to work

approved_concepts.label: Drive Alone to Work
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage commuting by driving alone

approved_concepts.label: Public Transportation Use
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage commuting by public transportation

approved_concepts.label: Work From Home
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage working from home

approved_concepts.label: Carpool to Work
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage commuting by carpooling
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as the proportion of workers 16 years and over who reported 'Carpooled' as their means of transportation to work (B08301_003) divided by the total number of workers 16 years and over (B08301_001).

approved_concepts.label: Walk to Work
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage walking to work
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate as B08301_019 (walked) divided by B08301_001 (total workers 16+) * 100. This is a standard commuting mode share calculation.

approved_concepts.label: Bike to Work
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage bicycling to work
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Calculate the rate as the proportion of workers 16 years and over who reported 'Bicycle' as their means of transportation to work. Use B08301_010E (bicycle commuters) as numerator and B08301_001E (total workers) as denominator.

approved_concepts.label: Vehicles Available
approved_concepts.definition: Number of vehicles available to household
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct extraction from B08201 table. Consider whether to use detailed breakdown (B08201_002 through B08201_006) or aggregate measure. Universe specification is correct for occupied housing units.

approved_concepts.label: Zero Vehicle Households
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage of households with no vehicle
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Use B08201: 'Household Size by Vehicles Available'. Numerator: B08201_002 (No vehicle available); Denominator: B08201_001 (Total occupied housing units). Calculate rate as B08201_002 / B08201_001.

approved_concepts.label: Departure Time for Work
approved_concepts.universe: Workers 16 years and over who did not work at home
approved_concepts.definition: Time of departure for work
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Direct lookup from ACS table B08302 which provides detailed breakdown of departure times in time intervals (e.g., 12:00 a.m. to 4:59 a.m., 5:00 a.m. to 5:29 a.m., etc.). Universe definition is precise and matches table universe.

approved_concepts.label: Commute Mode by Age
approved_concepts.definition: Transportation to work by age groups
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B08101 (Means of Transportation to Work by Age) provides direct cross-tabulations of commute mode by age for workers 16 years and over. Use the relevant rows and columns to extract counts by mode and age group.

approved_concepts.label: Commute Mode by Income
approved_concepts.definition: Transportation to work by earnings
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B08119 provides a cross-tabulation of means of transportation to work by earnings in the past 12 months. Data is available at multiple geographic levels and represents a standard Census product.

approved_concepts.label: Long Distance Commuters
approved_concepts.definition: Percentage with commutes over 60 minutes
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B08012 provides the number of workers 16 years and over by travel time to work. The percentage of long distance commuters (commutes over 60 minutes) can be calculated as the sum of the relevant categories (e.g., '60 to 89 minutes', '90 or more minutes') divided by the total number of workers who did not work at home.

approved_concepts.label: Senior Transportation
approved_concepts.definition: Transportation patterns for senior workers
approved_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B08101 provides means of transportation to work by age, with detailed breakdowns for workers 65+ years. Direct extraction of senior worker transportation patterns is straightforward.

modified_concepts.label: Non-Family Households
modified_concepts.definition: Households without related individuals
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: Non-family households are directly reported in ACS Table B11001 ('Household Type (Including Living Alone)'). Use B11001_007 (Nonfamily households) for the count. The universe is 'Households', which matches the table universe.
modified_concepts.modification_reason: The concept of 'Non-Family Households' is a standard Census/ACS construct and is directly tabulated in B11001. The definition should be clarified: non-family households are those where the householder lives alone or with non-relatives only (no relatives present). The table mapping is accurate, but the definition should be updated for precision. No calculation is needed; this is a direct lookup.

modified_concepts.label: Single Parent Households
modified_concepts.definition: Households with single parents and children
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: The concept 'Single Parent Households' is not directly available as a single variable in B11001. Instead, it must be calculated from B11003, which breaks down household types by presence of own children under 18 and by family structure (male/female householder, no spouse present). Sum the relevant rows for 'Family households: Male householder, no wife present, with own children under 18 years' and 'Family households: Female householder, no husband present, with own children under 18 years'. Universe should be 'Households with own children under 18 years'.
modified_concepts.modification_reason: While 'Single Parent Households' is a valid and commonly used demographic concept, it is not directly reported in B11001, which only distinguishes between family and nonfamily households. B11003 provides the necessary breakdown to identify single-parent households with children. The calculation is moderate in complexity, requiring summing two cells. The universe should be clarified to focus on households with own children under 18. The method is a count, which is appropriate.

modified_concepts.label: People Living Alone
modified_concepts.definition: Individuals living in single-person households
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: Universe should be 'People' or 'Population' rather than 'Households' since we're counting individuals, not household units. Use B11001_008 (1-person household estimate) for direct lookup.
modified_concepts.modification_reason: This is a statistically valid and commonly used demographic concept. Table B11001 (Household Type Including Living Alone) contains the exact data needed in cell _008. However, there's a conceptual mismatch: the universe should reflect that we're counting people (individuals living alone) rather than households (single-person household units). While the numeric result is identical, the conceptual framing matters for ontological clarity. The statistical method 'count' is appropriate, and this is a simple direct table lookup requiring no calculation.

modified_concepts.label: Disability Status
modified_concepts.definition: Population with disabilities by type
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: B18101 provides basic disability status counts, but comprehensive disability analysis requires multiple B181xx tables for different age groups and disability types. Consider specifying whether seeking overall disability status or specific disability types.
modified_concepts.modification_reason: Disability status is a well-established Census concept measured through the American Community Survey using six disability questions covering hearing, vision, cognitive, ambulatory, self-care, and independent living difficulties. The statistical method (count) and universe (civilian noninstitutionalized population) are appropriate. However, B18101 alone only provides disability status by sex and age - a complete picture requires the full B181xx series. The concept is valid but the table mapping needs expansion to reflect the full scope of available disability data in the ACS.

modified_concepts.label: Geographic Mobility
modified_concepts.definition: Population mobility and migration patterns
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: Table B07003 provides direct counts of geographic mobility status by residence 1 year ago. Consider specifying whether focus is on total movers, non-movers, or specific mobility categories (same house, different house same county, etc.)
modified_concepts.modification_reason: Geographic mobility is a core Census/ACS concept with strong statistical validity. Table B07003 'GEOGRAPHICAL MOBILITY IN THE PAST YEAR BY AGE FOR CURRENT RESIDENCE IN THE UNITED STATES' directly provides this data with universe 'Population 1 year and over' matching exactly. The statistical method 'count' is appropriate as this measures population counts by mobility status. However, the definition 'Population mobility and migration patterns' is somewhat vague - it should specify whether referring to total mobile population, specific mobility types, or rates. The concept should be modified to clarify the specific mobility measure being captured, but the underlying statistical framework is sound.

modified_concepts.label: Residence One Year Ago
modified_concepts.definition: Geographic location of residence one year ago
modified_concepts.implementation_notes: B07001 provides counts of the population 1 year and over by current residence and residence 1 year ago (same house, different house in US, abroad, etc.). For more detailed geography, B07003 (by county) or other B07-series tables may be relevant. The universe and method are appropriate.
modified_concepts.modification_reason: The concept 'Residence One Year Ago' is a valid and directly measurable ACS concept, with B07001 as a primary table.
